you
Pirlo English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 125 in today's
episode I have a new idiom for you icing
on the cake let's find out what it means
and how you can use it in your daily
conversation icing on the cake when good
things happen and followed by something
better you feel extremely thrilled it
feels like you have gotten a bonus the
idiom icing on the cake basically means
something good is added to good that
already exists or something bad is added
to bad making it even worse cake is good
and you should be happy with just the
cake but if you get icing on the cake
that makes it much better when something
is said to be the icing on the cake it
generally refers to a dit benefit that
makes the already obtained outcome
arrangement or a deal a whole lot nicer
this idiom can be used in the negative
sense as well when one bad thing happens
and another bad thing happens on top of
it the second bad thing is the icing on
the cake okay now that you know what
this idiom means let's take a look at
some example sentences to see how you
can use it in your daily conversation
example one going down on his needs to
propose marriage to Kathy was the icing
on the cake
example to receiving the best student
award from her favorite professor was
the icing on the cake for Michele
example3 the young couple got a fully
furnished house in their budget it was
icing on the cake example for an
efficient customer support service team
is the icing on the cake for all
organizations example 5 it was icing on
the cake this Christmas when mrs.
Anderson received a gift voucher from
her son's first salary example 6 getting
a salary raise along with being promoted
as the head of department was the icing
on the cake that left mark feeling very
thrilled
example 7 William missed his bus to work
waiting for the next bus that was
delayed was the icing on the cake
example 8 working with a secretary who
is not only intelligent but also
beautiful is an icing on the cake
example 9 after losing her father Amy
lost her job which was an icing on the
cake that led to her depression example
10 being bullied after a fight with her
friends was the icing on the cake
that may demand a very sad
